editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: PATRISTICA ET THEOLOGICA; S. XIV in., XIII

physDesc.p: Three originally independent books, brought together during s. xiv.

supportDesc.extent: 235 leaves (ii + 233) 340 240 The edges savagely retrimmed with loss of writing in three margins, and spattered with red.

handDesc.handNote: The same small neat anglicana hand annotates all parts of the book, I and III heavily; another annotates II only.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. fols. i-ii, 1 and 231–3 are of thick, stiff parchment. The outermost leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding with wooden boards. At the foot of fol. 233v is the mark of a brass chain-staple. Near the foot of fol. 230 (the last leaf of quire 21) are the marks of the large iron chain-staple.

history.provenance: At the head of fol. 123v, written with a stylus, ‘Iste .x. pecie 9 originalium uendantur pro viii sol’’.

On fol. 230v ‘Caucio magistri Iohannis de Renham exposita in cista de Roburi pro ...
in die Mercurii proxima post festum sancte Agathe anno domini MCCCXLVI’, and other erased cautio notes, including ‘Caucio Iohannis ?Wordeham ... / millesimo CCC ... ’, and ‘Supplementum ... magistris I. de Renham et Rich’ de Byllingham’. John Reynham (BRUO 1570–1), fellow 1335–58, was chancellor of Oxford University 1361–3, d. 1376. Billingham (BRUO 188–9) was fellow in 1344, still in 1361, the latest date at which he is known to have lived.

At the head of fol. 2, cropped by the binder, is ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ ex legato Magistri Iohannis Raynham sacre pagine professoris uniuersitatis Oxon’ et quondam socii eiusdem domus cuius anime propicietur Deus Amen.’

On fol. 1v is a table of contents and ‘N. 2. 6. Art:’, s. xvii. The same hand writes the same shelf-mark inside the front board, where it is canc. and replaced with ‘B. 2. 6 (XVIII)’ in red. A sheet of paper has another table of contents, s. xvii, canc. with a cross-reference to that on fol. 1v. The College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Serm. 128. 7–12
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de penitencia anime

msItem.title: Sermo de Tempore Barbarico
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de penitencia
msItem.incipit: Admonet Dominus Deus noster non debere negligere nostra peccata

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Eleemosyna (Serm. 61)
msItem.rubric: Excitacio fidelis anime ad elemosinam faciendam a beato Augustino edita in rogacionibus
msItem.incipit: In lectione sancti euangelii hortatus est nos Dominus ad orandum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo beati Augustini de elemosina

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Tractatus de Obedientia
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus beati Augustini de humilitate et hobediencia

msItem.explicit: qui habet aures audiendi audiat in Christo Iesu D. n.
msItem.note: CPL 605; PL 40. 1221–4; Stegmüller, Bibl. 3312; Lambert 240; Römer 1. 137–8; Bloomfield 3212.

msItem.author: Patrick of Dublin
msItem.title: De Triplici Tabernaculo
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de gaudio electorum et supplicio dampnatorum
msItem.incipit: Tria sunt sub omnipotentis Dei manu habitacula
msItem.note: Ed. A. Gwynn (Scriptores Latini Hiberniae 1: Dublin, 1955), pp. 106–25.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Opere Monachorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus beati Augustini de opere monachorum
msItem.incipit: Nouimus monachos in quandam sanctam ciuitatem
msItem.note: The full text CPL 305; CSEL 41 (1900), pp. 529–96.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Disciplina Christiana
msItem.rubric: Incipit Augustinus de disciplina Christianorum
msItem.incipit: Locutus est ad nos sermo Dei

msItem.author: Isidore
msItem.title: Synonyma
msItem.rubric: Incipit dialogus hominis plangentis et racionis consolantis secundum eundem Augustinum Aureliensem episcopum.Hic introducuntur persone duorum deflentis hominis scilicet et amonentis rationis.
msItem.incipit: Homo. Anima mea in angustiis est
msItem.explicit: (2. 39) Si ceciderit inimicus tuus non debes letari quia cito poteris et tu cadere in eodem periculo

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: De Visitatione Infirmorum
msItem.rubric: Incipit libellus sancti Augustini de uisitatione infirmorum et qualiter sacerdos se debeat continere erga infirmum et quomodo eum instruat qui moriendus est
msItem.incipit: Visitacionis gratia Nepoti meo k. morienti extremum ualedicturus hesterna die processi
msItem.explicit: ad Deum iustificatus ab Ipso qui ...

msItem.author: Paschasius Radbertus
msItem.title: Epistola ad Fredegardum
msItem.rubric: Paschasius de corpore Christi
msItem.incipit: Dilectissimo fratri et commilitoni Fredugardo Paschasius senex
Relictis litteris tuis

msItem.author: Paschasius Radbertus
msItem.title: De Corpore et Sanguine Domini ad Placidum
msItem.rubric: Versus Paschasii de corpore et sanguine Domini
msItem.incipit: Regis adire sacre qui uis solempnia mense
Dilectissimo filio et uicem Christi possidenti magistro ...; Quisque
msItem.explicit: catholicorum recte Domini cuncta creasse de nichilo corde credit ... quantocius uenire ualeamus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de corpore et sanguine Domini

msItem.author: Ivo of Chartres
msItem.title: Sermones de Sacramentis
msItem.rubric: De sacramentis. (Added later Liber Pascasii).

msItem.incipit: Quoniam populus ad fidem uocatus
Quia Christianam miliciam in baptismate professi estis
Quia saunctitas ministerii saunctitatem expetit
Beneficia que pro saluandorum reconciliacione

msItem.author: Thomas Gallus (of Vercelli)
msItem.title: Compendium of Ps.-Dionysius
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Dionisii de diuinis nominibus
msItem.incipit: Domine Dominus noster quam admirabile est nomen tuum non solum mirabile sed admirabile
Continentia primi capituli de diuinis nominibus
(fol. 52v De Hierarch. Celest.) Cum in libris magni Dionisii
Omne bonum datum naturalium et omne donum naturam perficiens
(fol. 63 De Hierarch. Eccl.) O Thimothee quam pluribus causis
msItem.note: The complete work ed. P. Chevallier, Dionysiaca (Paris, 1937–49), pp. 673–717, 1043–66; Glorieux, Théol. 116a-c.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Videndo Deo (Epist. 147)

msItem.title: Epist. 92

msItem.explicit: Non solum litteris tuis ... sermone melior explicare

msItem.title: Serm. 391
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo eiusdem ad iuuenes

msItem.title: De Bono Coniugali

msItem.title: De Ordine I

msItem.incipit: De ordine rerum Zenobi consequi ac tenere

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 60 lines. Written space 265 140

handDesc.handNote: Two gothic rotunda bookhands, changing at fol. 79va line 5; probably neither is English.

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain red or blue initials and paraphs, ceasing after art. 12.

msItem.title: Postills on 2 Tim., Titus, Philemon, Hebr., Eph.

msItem.rubric: Incipit argumentum in secundam epistolam ad Timotheum
msItem.incipit: Item Timotheo scribit ...; Secundum aliquos de carcere s. secundum alios non est littera
In isto argumento tanguntur quatuor cause sequentis epistole
Paulus &c. Hugo. Epistola dicitur ab epi que est supra et stolon missus
(fol. 131)Titum commonefacit ...; In isto tanguntur quattuor cause sequentis epistole
Paulus &c. Hugo. Epistola diuiditur in 3. partes, in salutacionem narracionem et condicionem

msItem.rubric: (fol. 135) Philemoni familiares litteras
msItem.incipit: In hoc argumento epistole sequenti premisso tanguntur 4
[P]aulus uinctus &c. Hugo. Epistola Pauli ad Philemonem habet 3 partes scilicet prohemium
(fol. 136) In primis dicendum est &c. Circa hunc prologum epistole subsequenti premissum sunt inquirende 4. cause sequentis epistole
Multiphariam in epistolis precedentibus posuit apostolus informacionem
(f. 165) Ephesi sunt Asiani &c. Apostolus isti epistolis sicut aliis argumentum premittit
Paulus apostolus &c. Incipit epistola Pauli ad Ephesios que principali diuisione in 3 diuiditur
msItem.explicit: amen quod interpretatur fiat ut dixi

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 60 lines; written space 290 165

handDesc.handNote: An English gothic rotunda bookhand, of similar appearance to those in I.

msItem.author: Rabanus Maurus
msItem.title: Commentary on Matthew
msItem.incipit: Cum post ascensionem Domini Spiritus Sanctus corda discipulorum illustrasset
Liber generationis Iesu Christi. In ipso exordio satis ostendit Matheus
msItem.explicit: in morte ipsius baptizati sumus et cetera
msItem.note: PL 107. 727–1156; Stegmüller, Bibl. 7060. At the foot of fol. 178 ‘Introitus secundum modernos’ in an anglicana hand, c. 1300. At the head is ‘Postilla Rabani super Matth: 29’, s. xvii.

msItem.author: Burgundio of Pisa
msItem.title: prol. to his translation of John Chrysostom, Homilies on John
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Burgundionis iudicis in commentatione Iohannis Crisostomi supra euangelium sancti Iohannis euuangeliste
msItem.incipit: Omnibus in Christo fidelibus fratribus Burgundio iudex ciuis Pisanus
Cum Constantinopoli pro negociis publicis patrie mee
msItem.note: ed. P. Classen, ‘Burgundio von Pisa’, Sitzungsberichte der Heidelberger Akademie der Wissenschaften, phil.-hist. Klasse (1974), 4 Abh., pp. 84–5 line 45; Stegmüller, Bibl. 4355.
On fol. 230v is a long table of contents, s. xiv, ending with the penultimate art.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 70 lines. Written space 260 180 .

handDesc.handNote: A small, neat early gothic bookhand.
